metadata.title: CVE-2021-38495 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
Mozilla developers reported memory safety bugs present in Thunderbird78.13.0. Some of these bugs showed evidence of memory corruption and wepresume that with enough effort some of these could have been exploited torun arbitrary code. This vulnerability affects Thunderbird < 91.1 andFirefox ESR < 91.1.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38495` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

thunderbird - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: thunderbird package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1:91.1.2+build1-0ubuntu1').
